name: Aloe Vera (Aloe barbadensis miller)
description: Succulent with fleshy, spiky leaves. Known for its medicinal properties, soothing sunburns and skin irritations. Requires bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Drought-tolerant plant, requiring minimal watering. Easy to propagate from offsets or pups. Adds a touch of greenery to sunny windowsills or indoor gardens. Symbolizes healing and resilience.

name: Bamboo Palm (Chamaedorea seifrizii)
description: Tropical palm with feathery fronds. Thrives in bright, indirect light but can tolerate lower light conditions. Requires consistently moist soil and high humidity. Filters indoor air pollutants, improving air quality. Adds a touch of tropical elegance to indoor spaces. Ideal for offices or living rooms with bright, indirect light. Symbolizes peace and tranquility.
